info.title: TinyStacks API
info.description:
The TinyStacks API provides REST API endpoints for creating and managing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployments on TinyStacks. Use this API to integrate TinyStacks deployments into your existing CI/CD infrastructure. 

## Creating a new IaC deployment

To create a new IaC deployment, first create a new code source using the [`/infrastructure-code-sources`](#/byo-infrastructure-code/create-iac-source) method. A code source consists primarily of a Git repository, along with settings indicating which IaC toolset your deployment uses. (Currently supported toolsets are the [AWS Cloud Development Kit](https://aws.amazon.com/cdk/) and [Terraform](https://www.terraform.io/).)

Creating a code source will start the initial IaC build and generate your build artifacts. To retrieve build logs for detailed error messages, use the [`/infrastructure-code-sources/logs/{sourceName}`](#/byo-infrastructure-code/get-source-logs) method.

Next, create a stack and its associated stages using the [`/infrastructure-code-stacks`](#/User%20Infrastructure%20Stack/create-iac-stack) method. A stack represents a release pipeline, with each stage being a step in the pipeline.

200.description: Returns the string Healthy Connection in an HTTP 200 response

get.summary: Retrieves all of the infrastructure code sources that are a part of the current group.
get.description:
This call lists all of your current infrastructure code sources as well as their current CI/CD statuses.

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

owner.description: The TinyStacks owner ID of this code source. This may be an individual user or a group.

name.description: The name assigned to the code course at creation time.

description.description: A free-text explanation of the source.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud platform targeted by any stacks for this code source.

diagramS3Link.description: A link to your application's architecture diagram.

latestVersion.description: The current version of your application. Freeform and used for your team's own tracking purposes.

repository.description: The Git repository from which to retrieve your application source code and Infrastructure as Code configuration files.

cloneUrl.description: The URL used for `git clone` operations.

defaultBranch.description: The branch that is active after the repository is first cloned.

owner.description: The account on the Git provider that owns and administrates the repository.

provider.description: The Git host to which the repository belongs.

infrastructureCodeType.description: The Infrastructure as Code toolset used to deploy your application and the toolset language used.

accountId.description: The unique ID of your cloud provider account.

region.description: The cloud region into which you will deploy this code source.

status.description: The status of your code source.

ciCdInfraStatus.description: The current status of your build.

createdOn.description: When this code source was originally created.

createdBy.description: The username of the TinyStacks owner who created this code source.

lastModifiedOn.description: When this code source was last changed.

lastModifiedBy.description: The username of the TinyStacks owner who last changed this code source.

parameters.description: Any additional input parameters to supply to the Infrastructure as Code toolset.

buildDetails.description: Output from the code source build for use in debugging.

stackCount.description: How many stacks exist that use this code source.

requirements.description: An array of cloud provider quotas and capabilities the application requires to install and run.

default.description: The specified resource was not found

post.description:
This call initializes the new code source, creates the CI/CD process for the specified infrastructure code type, and starts the first build. The result is a set of build artifacts. Use a GET call to [/infrastructure-code-sources](#/byo-infrastructure-code/list-iac-sources) to get the current status of the build from the `ciCdInfraStatus` parameter. 

Once you have initialized a new source, you can create one or more stacks with a POST to the [/infrastructure-code-stacks](#/byo-infrastructure-code/createIacStack) method.

A code source must target a specific cloud provider. To create multi-cloud deployments with the same code base, make separate calls to this method with different values for the `cloudProvider` parameter. 

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

### Example request payload

```json
{
    "name": "test-demo",
    "description": "A demo code source",
  "region": "us-east-2",
    "cloudProvider": "aws",
  "repository": {
    "cloneUrl": "https://github.com/tinystacks/awscdk-samples-eks-rds.git",
    "defaultBranch": "main",
    "name": "awscdk-samples-eks-rds",
    "provider": "github",
    "owner": "tinystacks"
  },
  "parameters": {
    "TEST_KEY": {
      "displayName": "test title",
      "propertyType": "String",
      "defaultValue": "some random value",
      "description": "Fill this out to do nothing",
      "required": true
    }
  },
  "infrastructureCodeType": {
    "format": "AWS_CDK",
    "language": "typescript"
  }
}
```

### Example cUrl command

```bash
curl https://api.tinystacks.com/infrastructure-code-source/ -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Authorization: Bearer XXXX" -d @payload.json
```

owner.description: The TinyStacks owner ID of this code source. This may be an individual user or a group.

name.description: The name assigned to the code course at creation time.

description.description: A free-text explanation of the source.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud platform targeted by any stacks for this code source.

diagramS3Link.description: A link to your application's architecture diagram.

latestVersion.description: The current version of your application. Freeform and used for your team's own tracking purposes.

cloneUrl.description: The URL used for `git clone` operations.

defaultBranch.description: The branch that is active after the repository is first cloned.

owner.description: The account on the Git provider that owns and administrates the repository.

provider.description: The Git host to which the repository belongs.

infrastructureCodeType.description: The Infrastructure as Code toolset used to deploy your application and the toolset language used.

accountId.description: The unique ID of your cloud provider account.

region.description: The cloud region into which you will deploy this code source.

status.description: The status of your code source.

ciCdInfraStatus.description: The current status of your build.

createdOn.description: When this code source was originally created.

createdBy.description: The username of the TinyStacks owner who created this code source.

parameters.description: Any additional input parameters to supply to the Infrastructure as Code toolset.

buildDetails.description: Output from the code source build for use in debugging.

get.summary: Retrieves information for the specified code source.
get.description:
Use this method to obtain information such as current CI/CD build status for a specific code source.

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

### Example cUrl request

```bash
curl https://api.tinystacks.com/infrastructure-code-sources/test-demo -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Authorization: Bearer $BEARER"
```

200.description: An InfrastructureCodeSource object describing the source.

owner.description: The TinyStacks owner ID of this code source. This may be an individual user or a group.

name.description: The name assigned to the code course at creation time.

description.description: A free-text explanation of the source.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud platform targeted by any stacks for this code source.

owner.description: The account on the Git provider that owns and administrates the repository.

provider.description: The Git host to which the repository belongs.

infrastructureCodeType.description: The Infrastructure as Code toolset used to deploy your application and the toolset language used.

accountId.description: The unique ID of your cloud provider account.

region.description: The cloud region into which you will deploy this code source.

status.description: The status of your code source.

requirements.description: An array of cloud provider quotas and capabilities the application requires to install and run.

default.description: The specified resource was not found

delete.description:
This deletes the specified code source definition, its CI/CD, and all artifacts.

[CHECK] You cannot delete a code source if there are stacks consuming it (i.e., if the `stackNumber` property of the `InfrastructureCodeSource` object is > 0).

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

### Example cUrl command

```bash
curl https://api.tinystacks.com/infrastructure-code-sources/test-demo -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Authorization: Bearer $BEARER"
```

owner.description: The TinyStacks owner ID of this code source. This may be an individual user or a group.

name.description: The name assigned to the code course at creation time.

description.description: A free-text explanation of the source.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud platform targeted by any stacks for this code source.

put.summary: Changes the parameters supplied to the Infrastructure as Code toolset.
put.description:
This changes the parameters supplied to the Infrastructure as Code toolset used to build your application artifacts. Changing parameters will trigger a new build. 

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

TEST_KEY.description: Fill this out to do nothing

200.description: A confirmation that the source parameters for builds have been successfully updated.

default.description: The specified resource was not found

put.summary: Adds a new version to the code source.
put.description: By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

200.description: Confirmation that the version has been updated. The response body is other empty.

default.description: The specified resource was not found

get.summary: Lists the source code changes to this code source.
get.description: By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

200.description: An array of `InfrastructureCodeSourceLedger` objects detailing the commits to this code source.

owner.description: The TinyStacks user ID or group that created and maintains this stack.

source.description: The identifying information for an InfrastructureCodeSource

owner.description: Owner of the InfrastructureCodeSource record (i.e. InfrastructureCodeSource.owner)

default.description: The specified resource was not found

get.summary: Lists stacks of users that reference this source.
get.description: By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

200.description: returns infrastructure stacks referenced by the provided source stack

default.description: The specified resource was not found

get.summary: Retrieves the build logs for this code source.
get.description:
Use this method to obtain information about why a CI/CD build for your code source failed. 
By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

200.description: An array of logs for your code source's latest build.

default.description: The specified resource was not found

get.summary: Returns a list of Infrastructure as Code stacks.
get.description:
Use the `SourceOwnerQuery` and `SourceNameQuery` parameters to search by the code source owner and code source name, respectively. This method will only return results that are accessible to the currently logged in user. 

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

200.description: An array of InfrastructureCodeStack objects describing your stacks.

owner.description: The TinyStacks user ID or group that created and maintains this stack.

source.description: The identifying information for an InfrastructureCodeSource

owner.description: Owner of the InfrastructureCodeSource record (i.e. InfrastructureCodeSource.owner)

default.description: The specified resource was not found

post.summary: Creates and deploys a new stack.
post.description:
A stack is a deployment of your code source across multiple stages. 

Each stage specifies a cloud region into which the stack is deployed. Use multiple stages to create deployments that span your software development lifecycle (e.g., development, testing, pre-prod, prod), as well as to deploy production code to multiple regions. 

By default, this method will look for a code source in your personal account. To retrieve a code source in a TinyStacks group, add the `group` header to your request. If the current user account does not have the required permissions to the specified group, the call will return an error.

owner.description: The TinyStacks user ID or group that created and maintains this stack.

source.description: The identifying information for an InfrastructureCodeSource

owner.description: Owner of the InfrastructureCodeSource record (i.e. InfrastructureCodeSource.owner)

201.description: A confirmation the stack has been created and a description of the stack as an `InfrastructureCodeStack` object.

owner.description: The TinyStacks user ID or group that created and maintains this stack.

source.description: The identifying information for an InfrastructureCodeSource

owner.description: Owner of the InfrastructureCodeSource record (i.e. InfrastructureCodeSource.owner)

default.description: The specified resource was not found
